util.xml
Class XHTML

java.lang.Object
  util.xml.XHTML

public class XHTML
extends java.lang.Object

Class creates XHTML format data from DOM nodes.

Method Detail

saveFullDocument

public static void saveFullDocument(org.w3c.dom.Document d,
                                    java.io.Writer w,
                                    boolean bIncludeXMLDeclaration,
                                    java.lang.String sLang)
                             throws java.io.IOException
Saves an XHTML element to a Writer.

Includes the junk that goes at the start of the document, and replaces the parent element with an <html> tag that contains the appropriate namespace information.

Parameters:
d - Document (The root element will be discarded and replaced with an <html> element, but attributes on it will be retained)
w - Writer to receive data
bIncludeXMLDeclaration - If true, includes... you know the drill
sLang - Default language of page
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the Writer reports any errors.

saveFullDocument

public static void saveFullDocument(org.w3c.dom.Element e,
                                    java.io.Writer w,
                                    boolean bIncludeXMLDeclaration,
                                    java.lang.String sLang)
                             throws java.io.IOException
Saves an XHTML element to a Writer.

Includes the junk that goes at the start of the document, and replaces the parent element with an <html> tag that contains the appropriate namespace information.

Parameters:
e - Parent element (any attributes etc. on this will be retained, but it will be replaced with an <html> element)
w - Writer to receive data
bIncludeXMLDeclaration - If true, includes... you know the drill
sLang - Default language of page
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the Writer reports any errors.

writePrologue

public static void writePrologue(java.io.Writer w,
                                 boolean bIncludeXMLDeclaration,
                                 java.lang.String sLang,
                                 org.w3c.dom.Element eElement)
                          throws java.io.IOException
Write the prologue of an XML file, up to the opening html tag (you must write the closing /html tag).

Parameters:
w - Writer
bIncludeXMLDeclaration - True to include the XML declaration
sLang - Language
eElement - Element for copying attributes from (may be null)
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Any error

save

public static void save(org.w3c.dom.Node n,
                        java.io.Writer w)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Saves an XHTML node to a Writer. Does not include the junk that goes at the start of a document, e.g. doctype etc.

Parameters:
n - Node to save
w - Writer to which node should be saved
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there is an I/O error (no, really?)

saveString

public static java.lang.String saveString(org.w3c.dom.Node n)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
Saves an XHTML node to a string. Does not include the junk that goes at the start of a document, e.g. doctype etc.

Parameters:
n - Node to save
Returns:
The string representation of the XML with root n.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there is an I/O error (no, really?)

escape

public static java.lang.String escape(java.lang.String sSource,
                                      int iEscapeType)
Escapes a string using HTML entities where necessary (use this when writing HTML 'by hand' rather than using save methods).

Parameters:
sSource - String that may contain triangle brackets and quotes
iEscapeType - Set to appropriate ESCAPE_xxx constant
Returns:
String that will contain HTML entities instead, and has illegal control characters stripped

setContentType

public static boolean setContentType(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
Sets the response MIME type based on browser capabilities.

Parameters:
request - Request (used to get Accept header)
response - Response (MIME type will be set)
Returns:
True if really using XHTML, false if HTML

output

public static void output(org.w3c.dom.Document d,
                          javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                          javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                          java.lang.String sLang)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Outputs an XHTML document in response to a servlet request.

Parameters:
d - Document to output
request - Servlet request
response - Servlet response
sLang - Language code e.g. "en"
Throws:
java.io.IOException - In event of I/O errors
